headline: They Don’t Need You to Be Perfect—They Need You to Return
body: Your repair is the parenting. Your softness is the memory. You’re allowed to be human as long as you come back with love.
prompt: What parenting moment this week might need repair—not punishment or over-explaining—but soft presence?

headline: Before They Regulate, They Borrow Yours
body: You are their nervous system until they have one of their own. Soften yours to teach them safety.
prompt: What moment with your child this week could use more presence and co-regulation instead of correction?

headline: You Can’t Regulate Them If You’re Not Regulated First
body: Your tone is louder than their behavior. When you regulate, they learn safety—even when things are messy.
prompt: What situation this week might go differently if you chose to respond from regulation, not your first reaction?
